oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Albumen print of General Alfred Eugene Jackson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alfred Eugene Jackson was born in Davidson County, Tennessee and attended Washington and Greeneville College. He remained in East Tennessee and joined the Confederate army. He ended up as a brigadier general in the Dept. of East Tenn. This is a post-war image of him on horse back. Upon his death he ordered that his horse be allowed to stay on the farm and was to be interred on the farm when the horse died. Jackson lived on the Nolichucky River. The horse was named Jeff Davis. Jackson died in 1889.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Alfred Eugene
